snippet: Efforts to tackle climate change have repeatedly collided with politics in Washington, where Republicans question the science of global warming, and ties to the fossil fuel industry have made them resistant to change.
abstract: Aggressive efforts to tackle climate change have repeatedly collided with political reality in Washington, where some Republicans question underlying science of global warming, and ties to fossil fuel industry have made them resistant to change; United Nations report says United States needs to enact major climate change law, such as a tax on carbon pollution, by the end of this decade to stave off the most catastrophic impacts of global warming.
lead_paragraph: Efforts to tackle climate change have repeatedly collided with politics in Washington, where Republicans question the science of global warming, and ties to the fossil fuel industry have made them resistant to change.

headline.main: Political Rifts Slow U.S. Effort on Climate Laws
headline.print_headline: Political Divide Slows U.S. Action on Climate Laws
